properties.address: Broadway Studio & Gallery, Letchworth Garden City, Hertfordshire SG6 3ES
properties.description: Broadway Gallery is based in Letchworth Garden City. We support and develop a programme of exhibitions, events and educational activities that inspire our community. At the heart of the Gallery is the Garden City Arts Club, a relaxed, informal space at the heart of the Gallery. It is a free, public area where you can meet others, catch up on work, or simply take a break. It’s open to everyone – whether you’re visiting the Gallery or just looking for a quiet, welcoming space. There are plenty of activities available for children too, making it a space for all ages. Bring your own packed lunch, connect to our free Wi-Fi, or help yourself to a hot drink or squash. There’s no pressure to buy anything, and no time limit on your stay – though donations are always welcome. The space also includes our shop, featuring a carefully curated range of greeting cards, gifts, and locally inspired items that celebrate Letchworth’s unique character.
properties.title: Broadway Gallery

properties.address: Walsworth Road Baptist Church, Hertfordshire SG4 9SP
properties.description: Cafe style space for all ages. Free drinks and snacks plus grab bags (to takeaway) with food, toiletries and general items. A chance to pop in, meet friends old and new, or just chill out on your own. All are welcome - Come & Say Hello!
properties.title: Cafe Connect

properties.description: Drop-in open to all. A place to meet, to relax or chat. A listening ear and advice service available.
properties.title: Community Connect Drop-In

properties.address: Letchworth Garden City Heritage Foundation, Letchworth Garden City, Hertfordshire SG6 3BF
properties.description: Museum at One Garden City is a vibrant micro-museum in Letchworth inviting visitors to discover the story of the world’s first Garden City. Beautifully designed, welcoming and interactive, the museum’s photographs, iconic objects and rotating décor, take audiences on a memorable journey through the commercial, educational, and domestic history of Letchworth Garden City. Learn how Letchworth’s founder, Ebenezer Howard, combined the best of both town and country to make the Garden City a great place to live and work. Admire the 60s retro sideboard and telephone table, and immerse yourself in the style of a mid-century home furnished by Meredew of Letchworth, one of the most important contemporary furniture manufacturers in the UK. Other design success stories that you can admire include the Chater-Lea bicycles and the Everyman’s Library, created by publisher J. M. Dent who built Temple Press in Letchworth to print the one shilling, which are now collectable classics. Offering something for everyone, young children can play at a full-size shop with counter and original working till. A smaller market stall entertains the younger shoppers with aromatic carbolic soap and pear drops evoking days gone by. Grab a pen and leave your mark on the museum’s whiteboard wall! Exhibits are updated regularly with historical objects from the Garden City Collection: an archive of over 250,000 objects looked after by the Heritage Foundation. The museum is located at One Garden City, off Broadway Gardens, and open every Monday to Saturday from 10am to 4pm.
properties.title: Museum at One Garden City

properties.description: Refresh is a drop-in, open Tuesday and Friday morning, 10:00 - 13:00. All are assured of a warm welcome and the opportunity to either sit and chat with others over a cuppa with cake/biscuits or there's space in the church or hall if you just want some down time by yourself. Some people drop in every week, others less frequently. Some stay all morning, others for just a short while. There is the opportunity to play board games ( a small group play Scrabble every week) and the Knit and Natter group meet some weeks.
properties.title: Refresh@Christchurch Hitchin

properties.address: Walsworth Road Baptist Church, Hertfordshire SG4 9SP
properties.description: Renew 2-9 is based around the 5 Ways to Wellbeing and is a space where those of any faith and of none are welcome to belong, to reduce social isolation and where people can encounter God's love. There is a short time of reflection at the beginning and end of each session for those that would like to join in. Our leaders look forward to welcoming you.
properties.title: Renew 2-9

properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 16th February 2024** Royston Museum's new Community Room will be open as a warm space from Friday 16 February. Everyone in our community is welcome to use our new warm space: adults, families and those in need. There will be tables and power points available for those needing space to work, a small selection of board games for those wishing to socialise plus additional activities and facilities for families. Free tea and coffee will be available. The warm space will be available during the Museum's normal opening hours: Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, 10am to 4pm. The Community Room will be unavailable on a small number of dates due to private bookings, however the rest of the Museum will be open to enjoy. Royston Museum is located near the centre of Royston, it is easily accessible by road, rail and public transport. The Museum is accessible via a ramp at the main entrance. The downstairs consists of the Exhibition Hall and a new accessible toilet with baby changing facilities. The Community Room is upstairs, so unfortunately is not accessible to all. Our team will be happy to help you find an alternate space downstairs in the Museum. Please email us at hello@roystonmuseum.org.uk if you have any questions before visiting.
properties.title: Warm Space at Royston Museum
